title: Inline banner on Report page discloses whether organization runs a private program

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
Hi team , @jobert
**Description:**

Your engineers have created inscription - `You are participating in a private program for â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ. Please do not publicly discuss the program until the program goes public.`

When a hacker creates a report in an external program with a private page, we will see this inscription, which makes it clear that the program has a private part.

When a hacker creates a report in an external program that does not have a private page , we will not see this inscription.

It's more of a logical mistake. To fix this, I think you need to give the inscription in all reports for all programmes
### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create publish report for any programs

2. If we are created report for â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ , â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ , ... We will see the inscription -
`You are participating in a private program for`***name_program***`. Please do not publicly discuss the program until the program goes public.` Because they have a private part

â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

3. if we are creted report for â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ, ... We won't see the inscription . Because they have not a private part

â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

Sorry i bad speak english
I hope you understand me
Thank you,haxta4ok00

## Impact

disclosure of external programs with private

additional_data.old_title: When creating a publish report, the name of private programs is disclosed
additional_data.new_title: Inline banner on Report page discloses whether organization runs a private program

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your report, always appreciated! I was able to reproduce the behavior you describe and I'll escalate this to the right engineering team. We will keep you posted throughout the process. Good luck and happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your report, always appreciated! I was able to reproduce the behavior you describe and I'll escalate this to the right engineering team. We will keep you posted throughout the process. Good luck and happy hacking!

activities.message: Hi @jobert -- Thanks! But , why this is low?) It also reveals a private program with external references
activities.markdown_message: Hi @jobert -- Thanks! But , why this is low?) It also reveals a private program with external references

activities.message:
Hi @jobert -- one more case for this,Perhaps this is the same behavior

1)Create publish report
2)Check report for json - 
3)Check parametr "team_private?"
â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

`"team_private?":true`

4)Check parametr "team_private?"
â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

`"team_private?":false`

If true -- external program have private page
If false -- external program have not private page

You are can see this two reports. Perhaps the error of this problem in this setting is that it is open to everyone?
If this is not the same as in this report, please let me know to submit a separate report. Thanks

activities.message:
> Hi @jobert -- Thanks! But , why this is low?) It also reveals a private program with external references

This only reveals the state value and is only exploitable on a subset of teams in our system.

> Perhaps this is the same behavior

Yes, you are correct it's the same issue. The banner was shown based on this specific attribute.

Hi @bencode -- Thank you for answer and bounty, but

>This only reveals the state value and is only exploitable on a subset of teams in our system.

I bad understand this.

Always when I found the ability to distinguish between private programs in external programs, without barriers, was the `medium value`, what has changed here?

For example â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ and â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ reports,

 Thanks! and happy Friday!

> what has changed here?

No specific changes here, it depends on the CVSS score we calculate, most of these, as far as I remember are low.

activities.message:
Haha, @haxta4ok00, you're fast ðŸ˜‰We did indeed release a fix for this yesterday evening. We look forward to hear from you again in the future. Thanks again, good luck, and happy hacking!

> Can you reconsider that? Thanks!

You are right, but we also didn't properly score the attack complexity, which should be High due to the external program requirement. I'll update the severity to reflect this. From what I can see, it'll remain a Low severity vulnerability though.
activities.markdown_message:
Haha, @haxta4ok00, you're fast ðŸ˜‰We did indeed release a fix for this yesterday evening. We look forward to hear from you again in the future. Thanks again, good luck, and happy hacking!

Can you reconsider that? Thanks!

You are right, but we also didn't properly score the attack complexity, which should be High due to the external program requirement. I'll update the severity to reflect this. From what I can see, it'll remain a Low severity vulnerability though.

activities.message:
Hi @jobert -- Thanks for the answer, but `attack complexity` why now `high`? :(

To carry out the attack, it was only necessary to create a report and all. no complications. as in all previous reports
There is also no difficulty. All you had to do was create a publish report, and watch the inscription if the program is private. :(
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert -- Thanks for the answer, but attack complexity why now high? :(

To carry out the attack, it was only necessary to create a report and all. no complications. as in all previous reports
There is also no difficulty. All you had to do was create a publish report, and watch the inscription if the program is private. :(

activities.message: Can you again reconsider this? I feel like it's a mistake again.ðŸ˜€
activities.markdown_message: Can you again reconsider this? I feel like it's a mistake again.ðŸ˜€

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - I appreciate your persistence but we will keep this scored as a low severity vulnerability as we believe the CVSS is correctly set. Like pointed out before, the attack complexity is set to high because it requires the program to have an external program. Previously scored reports are not a guarantee for a certain severity in the future. A threat model can change. Cheers!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - I appreciate your persistence but we will keep this scored as a low severity vulnerability as we believe the CVSS is correctly set. Like pointed out before, the attack complexity is set to high because it requires the program to have an external program. Previously scored reports are not a guarantee for a certain severity in the future. A threat model can change. Cheers!

activities.message:
Hey @jobert -- A bit surprised . I just keep taking your word from one of the reports.


Hi haxta4ok00 - thanks again for pointing out this security vulnerability. We've determined that the severity of this vulnerability is medium, which is why we're rewarding you with a $2,500 bounty. Even though the data itself isn't particularly sensitive, this issue can be used to `determine whether external programs in our Directory are running private programs. This was a good find, thanks!`

That was news to me. Sorry
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @jobert -- A bit surprised . I just keep taking your word from one of the reports.

Hi haxta4ok00 - thanks again for pointing out this security vulnerability. We've determined that the severity of this vulnerability is medium, which is why we're rewarding you with a $2,500 bounty. Even though the data itself isn't particularly sensitive, this issue can be used to determine whether external programs in our Directory are running private programs. This was a good find, thanks!

That was news to me. Sorry

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - in all other cases, more information was leaked. In this case, from what we could see from our end, only the existence of a program could be determined. Because of that the severity is determined to be low.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - in all other cases, more information was leaked. In this case, from what we could see from our end, only the existence of a program could be determined. Because of that the severity is determined to be low.

activities.message: Hi @jobert -- Thank you for giving an additional answer!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @jobert -- Thank you for giving an additional answer!

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - no problem, always a pleasure receiving reports from you! This is ready to be disclosed. Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - no problem, always a pleasure receiving reports from you! This is ready to be disclosed. Happy hacking!
